item.title: Euro Falls After Weak German PMI Data
item.description: EUR/USD fell to a two-month low of 1.0814 after provisional purchasing managers’ surveys for Germany showed activity contracting, with services unexpectedly weak.

item.title: Oil Weakens on Economic Worries
item.description: Oil prices weakened in Europe as they faced headwinds from stronger supplies and concerns about a challenging macroeconomic backdrop.

item.title: German Business Activity Sinks Deeper into Contraction
item.description: The Germany Composite PMI fell to 44.7 in August, its steepest decline in more than three years, as the country’s key manufacturing sector continued to struggle.

item.title: Metals Inch Higher as Dollar Pressure Recedes
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were higher in early London trading, with Standard Chartered saying price action in base metals markets continued to be in thrall of macro drivers, risk appetite, U.S. dollar moves and China macro data flow.

item.title: Disappointment, Fear Cloud Zimbabwe Election
item.description: Zimbabweans cast their ballots in an election clouded by years of dizzyingly high inflation as well as intimidation from a ruling party that has been in power for more than four decades.

item.title: Is Nvidia the New Tesla? Options Traders Place Their Bets
item.description: Investors are wagering that the furious rally in Nvidia shares will continue after Wednesday’s earnings report.

item.title: French Government Bond Yields Fall After Provisional PMI Data
item.description: French government bond yields extended falls after the provisional PMI for France came in slightly better than expected, albeit still showing activity in contractionary territory.

item.title: Hollywood Studios Make Public Their Latest Offer to Striking Writers
item.description: Among the concessions the studios said they offered are a guaranteed minimum length of employment, controls around the use of generative AI and wage increases.

item.title: Sasol Cuts Dividend After Profit Falls
item.description: Sasol reported adjusted underlying earnings for the year of ZAR66 billion, in line with its guided range, but cut its dividend after net profit came in sharply lower due to booking a number of impairments.

item.title: India's Sensex Flat, Supported by Industrial, Tech Stocks
item.description: India’s benchmark Sensex was flat at 65217.79 as gains in industrial and tech stocks help offset losses in auto and financial stocks.

item.title: How Goldman Sachs Fumbled Its Consumer Business
item.description: When Goldman Sachs entered the credit card space in 2019, many consumer banks were concerned that a new competitor had emerged. But just four years later, the firm is pulling back. We explain why.

item.title: Wall Street's China Dreams Slip Away
item.description: U.S. banks and asset managers are struggling to expand their businesses while tensions with China escalate.

item.title: Ukraine's Reset: A Slow and Bloody Advance on Foot
item.description: After the failures of the initial armored assaults, which were blunted by Russian defenses, Kyiv resorted to small units attacking one position at a time.

item.title: The Teamsters ratified a new five-year, $30 billion contract with UPS, ending the prospects of a labor standoff that could have been damaging for supply chains.
item.description: The Teamsters ratified a new five-year, $30 billion contract with UPS, ending the prospects of a labor standoff that could have been damaging for supply chains.

item.title: A new 1% tax on buybacks is starting to increase companies' expected tax burdens, to the tune of over $3.5 billion in the first half of 2023 among the largest U.S. public companies.
item.description: A new 1% tax on buybacks is starting to increase companies’ expected tax burdens, to the tune of over $3.5 billion in the first half of 2023 among the largest U.S. public companies.

item.title: Thousands of Airbnb listings in New York are vanishing from the market ahead of a Sept. 5 deadline, when the city says it will enforce rules on short-term rentals more aggressively.
item.description: Thousands of Airbnb listings in New York are vanishing from the market ahead of a Sept. 5 deadline, when the city says it will enforce rules on short-term rentals more aggressively.

item.title: Home sales declined in July for the fourth time in five months, extending one of the deepest housing-market slumps in recent memory.
item.description: Home sales declined in July for the fourth time in five months, extending one of the deepest housing-market slumps in recent memory.

item.title: Stocks edged lower after disappointing earnings reports from retailers. The S&P 500 declined 0.3%, while the Dow Industrials fell 0.5%.
item.description: Stocks edged lower after disappointing earnings reports from retailers. The S&P 500 declined 0.3%, while the Dow Industrials fell 0.5%.

item.title: Thailand's Parliament picked real-estate tycoon Srettha Thavisin as the next prime minister, in a democratic advance after nearly a decade of military-backedrule.
item.description: Thailand’s Parliament picked real-estate tycoon Srettha Thavisin as the next prime minister, in a democratic advance after nearly a decade of military-backed rule.

item.title: Traders are ramping up their bets that the blockbuster rally in Nvidia's shares will accelerate after the chip manufacturer issues its earnings report on Wednesday.
item.description: Traders are ramping up their bets that the blockbuster rally in Nvidia’s shares will accelerate after the chip manufacturer issues its earnings report on Wednesday.
